messages.content:
Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools. Let's unlock Britain's future.
The last few years have been frustrating. I get it. I've been just as frustrated as you.
We've had three years of a hung parliament that agrees on nothing except more arguments.
But we don't have to go on like this. Together, we can end the doom and gloom.
The country needs a majority government. And you can secure it with your postal vote.
The great thing about a majority government is that it can get stuff done. And that's exactly what we'll do.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Passing our Brexit deal—which is agreed and ready to go from day one. It protects jobs and trade. It means we can leave the EU by the end of January.
£33.9 billion extra for the NHS. So your hospital and local GPs can give you the healthcare you need.
More funding for every pupil in every school. So your child gets the best start in life.
A growing economy that creates more jobs and pays for our public services.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Let's put the last three years behind us. Last time we were just NINE seats short of a majority.

issues.brexitEurope: Passing our Brexit deal—which is agreed and ready to go from day one. It protects jobs and trade. It means we can leave the EU by the end of January.
issues.economy: A growing economy that creates more jobs and pays for our public services.
issues.education: More funding for every pupil in every school.
issues.health: £33.9 billion extra for the NHS. So your hospital and local GPs can give you the healthcare you need.

examples: Last time we were just NINE seats short of a majority.
The last few years have been frustrating. I get it. I've been just as frustrated as you.
Together, we can end the doom and gloom.
Britain has spent too long going nowhere, spinning round in a hamster wheel of doom.
The great thing about a majority government is that it can get stuff done.
Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools. Let's unlock Britain's future.
Our postal vote can secure a majority government.
Passing our Brexit deal—which is agreed and ready to go from day one.
A growing economy that creates more jobs and pays for our public services.
We've had three years of a hung parliament that agrees on nothing except more arguments.
Britain has spent too long going nowhere, spinning round in a hamster wheel of doom.
